topic.title: zbookdb, five books, every week
topic.body:
I have a huge library of ebooks, so I thought I'd just create a zite that lists five of them every week: http://127.0.0.1:43110/14r4f8nQVr4jBuX2PxLJmjbSHF9pTyeieS/

Have fun :)

1576403647_1NuYeSsttVbZHrWGpWVauTz25DikW.body:
mg0: Thanks for your comments. The goal of the website is indeed to have five books each week, with the books of the week before unlisted. For the file names, I had to decide between making them easy to save (the right name) or easy on ZeroNet. I'm not sure yet, I'll look more deeply into my options. Also, I totally forgot I could have multiple content.json files. Thanks for bringing that up :)

As for the book "The Mastermind" 404ing, I can't offer any help. The link works fine locally and on a (private) ZeroNet proxy running on a VPS. You may want to increase the size limit for the zite (it is currently 23MB, with "The Mastermind" taking 13MB of that)

Thinking of it, it might have 404ed because the file is larger than 10MB. I've gone ahead and made the "books/" directory optional, so ZN should now send the file around as expected! (due to big files/torrent support for optional files)

> [mg0](#comment_197_1LbP2cNA6NkvuFJvs7McUmv9qGjkNqVkTa): It's downloading now, it's rather big.

Ebooks can get quite big indeed. I even have 60-70MB epub files...

> [randomshits](#comment_328_1CuFETj5LtyEduzaoAcdv9sMAQtYRqjqDY): Thanks for marking them as optional.

My pleasure! Have a nice time reading :)

> [randomshits](#comment_375_1CuFETj5LtyEduzaoAcdv9sMAQtYRqjqDY): It seems zbookdb.bit is finally working.

I tried to register the domain a few days ago, and wondered why someone took it. Tried it a few days before that, and it wasn't registered yet. I needed some time to acquire some NameCoin.

If the owner would be so kind, I wouldn't be against a transfer of d/zbookdb to NEZBvkDnT1VB7hQc3RtxSg4QqT8cAsxVzb (my wallet)

1577908716_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
My recommendation: get yourself a pair of 6 to 10TB drives, then configure them as mirrored drives. If you don't want to have an entire system to put the disks in, you can get away with a Raspberry 4 and 2x USB to SATA converters. It will last a decade.

If that's above your budget, a Google Business account with unlimited storage costs 50$ a month. Other online storage providers include all S3 compatible ones, like Scaleway ($.01 per GB per month) or Wasabi ($.0059 per GB per month, 3 month minimum file retention).

There are plenty of options.
